titleStmt.title: The third and last part of Palmerin of England Enterlaced with the loues and fortunes of many gallant knights and ladies: a historie full of most choise and sweet varietie. VVritten in Spanish, Italian, and French, and translated into English by A.M. one of the messengers of her Maiesties chamber.
Palmerin of England (Romance). Part 3. English.
titleStmt.author: Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633.
Hurtado, Luis, ca. 1510-ca. 1598, attributed name.
Morais, Francisco de, ca. 1500-1572, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I[ames] R[oberts] for VVilliam Leake, at the signe of the Greyhound in Paules Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: A translation of part 3 of: Palmerin of England.
Sometimes attributed to Francisco de Morais and to Luis Hurtado.
Running title reads: The third part of Palmerin of England.
With an appended note by Munday and five final contents leaves.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: the signe of the Greyhound in Paules Church-yard
